trivia_items.text: Her name derives from the Greek name for Cerberus, Kérberos (Κέρβερος). A three-headed dog that obviously represents the Cerberus can be seen in Ceobe's Elite 2 artwork.
sub_items: Ceobe's birthday, March 3rd (third day of the third month, or 3/3), and the fact that she has three skills with three different targeting priorities are also references to Cerberus.

The  Delicious Honey Biscuit used in Ceobe's Fungimist is a reference to a practice of the ancient Greeks. Upon someone's death, they would put a piece of honey cake inside the coffin to please Cerberus.

trivia_items.text: Interestingly, Ceobe's skills make her attack by using weapons identical to all three of Kratos' weapons in God of War: Ragnarök: Leviathan Axe ("Really Cold Axe"), Blades of Chaos ("Really Hot Knives"), and Draupnir Spear ("Really Heavy Spear"). Like Ceobe, Kratos is also based from Ancient Greek mythology.
While non-canon, the "Return to the Wild" ending of Ceobe's Fungimist where it is highly implied that Ceobe dies is the very first instance of an Operator's death in Arknights.
